page.title: 05Shearing Time
page.content: Every summer we shear the sheep.We have to prepare for the shearing. We had to make a place where we catch the sheep. Then make a place for the men to shear.Then we go to get nettles to put under the sheep because it does not stick in the wool like straw.The day after we go and get the sheep. I have a sheep dog to help me go up the hill to get the sheep down. We put the sheep in the shed. Then we begin the shearing. Thereare two people catching, four are searing the sheep.There are some packing the wool and putting it in bags. The men do about 150 sheep a day. When they have finished shearing and packing the wool in the bags we sell the wool.
